thread.title: Elvis Festival celebrates 14th year in Bad Nauheim, Germany
thread.title_full: Elvis Festival celebrates 14th year in Bad Nauheim, Germany

author: By Jeanne Cooper
title: Elvis Festival celebrates 14th year in Bad Nauheim, Germany
text:
Elvis Festival celebrates 14th year in Bad Nauheim, Germany Jeanne Coope , San Francisco Chronicle By Jeanne Cooper Published 6:31 pm, Thursday, July 2, 2015 The all-inclusive Twin Farms resort in Barnard, Vt., now offers several varieties of yoga on a new treetop deck as well as yoga hikes through the 300-acre wooded property. Photo: Twin Farms The all-inclusive Twin Farms resort in Barnard, Vt., now offers... JourneYou’s new six-day Buenos Aires Tango Festival tour, departing Aug. 21, includes sightseeing in Argentina’s capital as well as events tied to the festival, which runs Aug. 12-25. Photo: Mark Knight JourneYou’s new six-day Buenos Aires Tango Festival tour,... The first capital of Cabo Verde, which became independent from Portugal in 1975, is now known as Cidade Velha (“Old City”) and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Photo: Sébastien Moriset, CRATerre-ENSAG The first capital of Cabo Verde, which became independent from... The 42 newly renovated Beach Cottages at Turtle Bay Resort on Oahu’s North Shore offer luxurious lodgings with private concierge service and exclusive Hawaiian-themed amenities. Photo: Turtle Bay Resort The 42 newly renovated Beach Cottages at Turtle Bay Resort on... A woman kisses a cutout of Elvis Presley in Bad Neuheim, Germany, where he served in the Army from 1958 to 1960. Photo: Bad Neuheim A woman kisses a cutout of Elvis Presley in Bad Neuheim, Germany,... 
Page 1 of 1 
Festival 
Germany: Bad Nauheim, where Elvis Presley served two years in the Army, hosts the 14th annual European Elvis Festival Aug. 14-16, offering concerts, a Cadillac parade and exhibitions. Guided and self-guided tours of the King’s traces in the town near Frankfurt take place year-round. www.bad- nauheim.com. 
Hotel renovation 
Oahu: Turtle Bay Resort has reopened its 42 renovated Beach Cottages, completing $45 million in remodeling across the 840-acre resort on the North Shore. The 740-square-foot cottages feature ocean-view lanais with wicker love seats, 15-foot ceilings, walnut floors and deep soaking tubs (from $599). www.turtlebayresort.com. 
New tour 
Argentina: The Buenos Aires Tango Festival, Aug. 12-15, inspires JourneYou’s new six-day tour, including a stay in a tango-themed hotel, a night of milonga (open-air dancing) and a show at Cafe de los Angelitos, as well as sightseeing and wine tasting. The trip departs Aug. 21; from $1,190, excluding airfare. www.journeyou.com. 
Holiday 
Cabo Verde: Formerly known as Cape Verde, the archipelago celebrates its 40th anniversary of independence on Sunday, July 5. Portuguese settled the then-uninhabited volcanic islands in the 1460s; the first capital, on the island of Santiago, is now called Cidade Velha (“Old City”) and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site (pictured). www.capeverde.com. 
New activities 
Vermont: Twin Farms, an all-inclusive, five-star resort in Barnard, has added yoga to all-American activities such as cycling, canoeing and fishing. A new treetop deck hosts a variety of yoga practices, while yoga hikes explore the 300 acres of woods and meadows. www.twinfarms.com.
